  • Method Details

    • authenticate

      public PlayerProfile authenticate(String name) throws NameAlreadyTakenException
      Authenticates a new player. The player must have a unique name.
      Parameters:
      name - the player to authenticate
      Returns:
      the player player
      Throws:
      NameAlreadyTakenException - if a player with the same specified nickname is already authenticated
      See Also:
      • PlayerManager.createProfile(String)

    • sendBroadcastMessage

      public Message sendBroadcastMessage(int gameId, String sender, String content) throws GameNotFoundException, NotAuthenticatedException, PlayerNotInGameException
      Sends a BroadcastMessage to everyone connected in game (that has gameId as ID) by appending the new message on ChatManager's message list
      Parameters:
      gameId - sender and recipient's game ID
      sender - sender of the message
      content - content of the message
      Returns:
      the Message sent
      Throws:
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified sender is not authenticated
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified sender is not in the game
      See Also:
      • BroadcastMessage
      • ChatManager

    • sendDirectMessage

      public Message sendDirectMessage(int gameId, String sender, String recipient, String content) throws GameNotFoundException, NotAuthenticatedException, InvalidRecipientException, MessageSentToThemselvesException, PlayerNotInGameException
      Sends a DirectMessage to recipient by appending the new message on ChatManager's message list
      Parameters:
      gameId - sender and recipient's game ID
      sender - sender of the message
      recipient - recipient of the message
      content - content of the message
      Returns:
      the Message sent
      Throws:
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified sender is not authenticated
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified sender is not in the game
      InvalidRecipientException - if the specified recipient is not in the same game as sender
      MessageSentToThemselvesException - if the specified sender is equal to recipient
      See Also:
      • DirectMessage
      • ChatManager

    • createAndJoinGame

      public Game createAndJoinGame(int maxPlayers, String playerName) throws PlayerAlreadyPlayingException, InvalidMaxPlayersException, IllegalGameStateException, NotAuthenticatedException
      Create a new game and make the creator immediately join
      Parameters:
      maxPlayers - the maximum amount of players that will be allowed to join the game
      playerName - the name of the creator of the game
      Returns:
      the created game
      Throws:
      PlayerAlreadyPlayingException - if the specified player is already in a game
      InvalidMaxPlayersException - if the specified maxPlayer value is not between 2 and 4
      IllegalGameStateException - if creating a new game is an invalid operation in this game state
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the player is not authenticated

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(int gameId, String playerName) throws PlayerAlreadyPlayingException, IllegalGameStateException, GameNotFoundException, NotAuthenticatedException
      Makes a player join a game
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game to be joined
      playerName - the name of the player that will join the game
      Throws:
      PlayerAlreadyPlayingException - if the specified player is already in a game
      IllegalGameStateException - if joining a game is an invalid operation in this game state
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the player is not authenticated
      See Also:
      • Game.join(PlayerProfile)

    • startGame

      public void startGame(int gameId) throws IllegalGameStateException, NotEnoughPlayersException, GameNotFoundException
      Starts a game, despite not having reached the maximum threshold of connected players
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game that have to start
      Throws:
      IllegalGameStateException - if starting the game is an invalid operation in this game state
      NotEnoughPlayersException - if the current number of players is lower than 2
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid

    • selectStartingCardSide

      public void selectStartingCardSide(int gameId, String playerName, Side side) throws IllegalGameStateException, PlayerNotInGameException, GameNotFoundException, NotAuthenticatedException, DoubleChoiceException
      Selects on which side to place the initial card of a certain player in a certain game, then places it.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game in which the player is playing
      playerName - the name of the player that will place the card
      side - the side on which the card will be placed
      Throws:
      IllegalGameStateException - if selecting the starting card side is an invalid operation in this game state
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified playerName is not in the game
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified playerName is not authenticated
      DoubleChoiceException - if the starting card side has already been chosen by the specified playerName
      See Also:
      • Game.selectStartingCardSide(PlayerProfile, Side)

    • selectPlayerColor

      public void selectPlayerColor(int gameId, String playerName, PlayerColor color) throws IllegalGameStateException, PlayerNotInGameException, GameNotFoundException, NotAuthenticatedException
      Selects a PlayerColor for a given player in a given game
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game in which the player is playing
      playerName - the name of the player that is making the choice
      color - the color to assign to the player
      Throws:
      IllegalGameStateException - if selecting the player color is an invalid operation in this game state
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified playerName is not in the game
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified playerName is not authenticated
      See Also:
      • Game.selectColor(PlayerProfile, PlayerColor)

    • selectSecretObjective

      public void selectSecretObjective(int gameId, String playerName, int objectiveId) throws IllegalGameStateException, PlayerNotInGameException, GameNotFoundException, NotAuthenticatedException, InvalidObjectiveException, DoubleChoiceException
      Selects the secret objective for a given player in a given game.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game in which the player is playing
      playerName - the name of the player that is making the choice
      objectiveId - the id of the objective that the player has chosen. Must be one of the objectives returned by Game.getObjectiveOptions(PlayerProfile) for the given player
      Throws:
      IllegalGameStateException - if selecting the secret objective is an invalid operation in this game state
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified playerName is not in the game
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified playerName is not authenticated
      DoubleChoiceException - if the secret objective has already been chosen
      InvalidObjectiveException - if the specified objectiveId is not one of the possible choices or does not exist
      See Also:
      • Game.selectObjective(PlayerProfile, Objective)
      • Game.getObjectiveOptions(PlayerProfile)

    • drawCardFromDeck

      public DrawResult drawCardFromDeck(int gameId, String playerName, DeckLocation deckLocation) throws IllegalMoveException, PlayerNotInGameException, GameNotFoundException
      Draws a card from the deck that is indicated by deckLocation and places it in the hand of the player
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game in which the player is playing
      playerName - the name of the player that is drawing the card
      deckLocation - which deck to draw from
      Returns:
      DrawResult.EMPTY if the deck was empty and thus the action had no effect, DrawResult.OK otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalTurnException - if it's not the turn of the specified playerName
      IllegalGameStateException - if drawing a card is an invalid operation in this game state
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified playerName is not in the game
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified playerName is not authenticated
      IllegalMoveException
      See Also:
      • Game.drawCard(PlayerProfile, DrawSource)

    • drawCardFromFaceUpCards

      public DrawResult drawCardFromFaceUpCards(int gameId, String playerName, int cardId) throws IllegalMoveException, PlayerNotInGameException, GameNotFoundException, InvalidCardException
      Draws a card from the group of cards that are facing up.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game in which the player is playing
      playerName - the name of the player that is drawing the card
      cardId - the ID of the card to draw. Must be the ID of one of the cards contained inside a FaceUpCard contained in Board.getFaceUpCards()
      Returns:
      always DrawResult.OK because, since the specified card must exist, it can always be put in the player's hand
      Throws:
      IllegalTurnException - if it's not the turn of the specified playerName
      IllegalGameStateException - if drawing a card is an invalid operation in this game state
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified playerName is not in the game
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified playerName is not authenticated
      InvalidCardException - if the specified cardId does not represent a FaceUpCard that is currently on the Board
      IllegalMoveException
      See Also:
      • Game.drawCard(PlayerProfile, DrawSource)

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard(int gameId, String playerName, int cardId, Side side, int i, int j) throws IllegalMoveException, PlayerNotInGameException, GameNotFoundException, InvalidCardException, IllegalPlacementException
      Places a card
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game in which the player is playing
      playerName - the name of the player that is placing the card
      cardId - the id of the card that should be placed. Must be the ID of one of the cards that the player has in their PlayerData.hand()
      side - specifies on which side to place the card
      i - the i coordinate on which to place the card
      j - the j coordinate on which to place the card
      Throws:
      IllegalTurnException - if it's not the turn of the specified playerName
      IllegalGameStateException - if placing a card is an invalid operation in this game state
      PlayerNotInGameException - if the specified playerName is not in the game
      GameNotFoundException - if the specified gameId is invalid
      NotAuthenticatedException - if the specified playerName is not authenticated
      InvalidCardException - if the specified cardId does not represent an existing Card
      IllegalPlacementException - if the specified position is not a playable position
      IllegalMoveException
      See Also:
      • Game.placeCard(PlayerProfile, Card, Side, int, int)
